thread.title: Man Utd defender Jones withdraws from England squad
thread.title_full: Man Utd defender Jones withdraws from England squad

title: Man Utd defender Jones withdraws from England squad
text:
Man Utd defender Jones withdraws from England squad Getty Images 0 21-Mar-2017 20:28:00 The centre-back will return to his club for treatment and will miss the matches against Germany and Lithuania as a result 
Manchester United defender Phil Jones has withdrawn from the England squad to face Germany through injury. 
Lindelof breaks silence over Man Utd 
Jones has returned to his club after sustaining an unspecified problem during training on Tuesday. 
There are no immediate plans to call up a replacement for Wednesday's friendly against the world champions at Signal Iduna Park, although boss Gareth Southgate will assess his options ahead of Sunday's World Cup qualifier against Lithuania as Chelsea centre-back Gary Cahill is suspended for the latter clash. 
Jones has made 22 appearances in all competitions for United this season, with knee and foot injuries hindering his progress. Phil Jones will return to #MUFC after being released from the England squad due to an injury sustained in training. pic.twitter.com/TUaonuzQFq â€” Manchester United (@ManUtd) March 21, 2017 
Fitness woes have been an unwelcomely common feature for the 25-year-old, who won the last of his 20 England caps as a substitute in the 2-0 friendly win over France in November 2015. Related
